meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Brian Mueller Liza Veeneman A.J. Motley Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6420.

td.p: Brian Mueller, an office administrator from Fountain City, Wisconsin
Liza Veeneman, a retired software developer from Aliso Viejo, California
A.J. Motley, a student of diagnostic sonography from Wylie, Texas (whose 2-day cash winnings total $56,002)

tr.td: (Alex: We want you to name the show for us.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'In 1925 the first of these lodging places along highways & byways appeared in San Luis Obispo, California')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: In 1925 the first of these lodging places along highways & byways appeared in San Luis Obispo, California

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(A.J.: What is a megaphone?)
(Alex: [Still amplifying his voice] You are right. No! You are not right. I\'ve just fallen in love with this. Brian.)
(Brian: What is [*]?)
(Alex: [*], yes. The category is "BULL"!, A.J.) [Alex puts the device down]
[Laughter]
(Alex: Brian, you pick.)

a bullhorn

A.J.Brian
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Alex demonstrates the clue, using a device to amplify his voice.) Use this device to really get your point across')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Alex demonstrates the clue, using a device to amplify his voice.) Use this device to really get your point across

Annie

LizaBrian
')

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: Versifacator Regis--of the king.)
...
(Alex: [To Liza] What is [*]--yes indeed. Writing verses for the king.)
LizaWhat is Poet Laureate?
$6,400
BrianWhat is Prince Regent
$8,600
A.J.What is a [illegible symbol]
$4,601
Poet Laureate')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'This appointed position first held by John Dryden echoes a "Versificator Regis" of Richard I in the 12th century')

tr.td: This appointed position first held by John Dryden echoes a "Versificator Regis" of Richard I in the 12th century
